title: Tired of "Win-Day, Lose-Day"
body:
Log in and win all my games, other lanes collapse to fights, people show up, have good competition.  Then log in the next day, every game people can't play their role, don't collapse, lose every game, same elo?  

Can we talk about why RIOT designs it this way?

replies.body:
What do you want to see in the next patch notes? Something like this?

**Usability issues:**

**It turned out that some players were seeing high and low streaks due to the nature of random elements in both the game and their mentality from day to day so we have adjusted the fundamental rules of the universe to ensure that the balance from variance is far more localized. It's kinda complex to explain but in the most basic terms you can remember that coin flips will now tend towards a Heads - Tails - Heads - Tails pattern compared to streaks of Heads or streaks of Tails and extrapolate that sense to all elements of your daily life, including League of Legends.**
it's not actually due to the random elements though, riots matchmaking works so that after a win streak you get worse teams to balance out the win ratio.

of course riot would never state this due to the shitstorm it would cause but it is indeed the case same as for many other "forced 50%" matchmaking systems. i cant link you to a statement by riot but i can tell you that this is the only explanation to some statistics.

Forced 50%? Yes, the matchmaking system tries to force you to have a 50% winratio (if you play enough). But it doesn't do this by matching you with worse teams, it does it by matching you with better/worse players in both teams.
If you have a G1 MMR and win 10 games in a row in one day then the system thinks you play on P4 level. Therefore it will match you with players who average P4 in both teams. But seeing how form depends on the day and you may have simply had a super great day but are unable to play at P4 niveau. 
That means on the next day when you play at G1 niveau again it's very likely that you lose a few games so that your MMR drops from P4-G1.

But seeing how most people tend to seek faults in their teammates rather then themselves they get the impression that not them, but their teams got worse. Riot has no interest in manipulating your winratio, why would they?

Hey, here is a match I was in after a win. Rito decided, "Oh you won a match Weasel, well its time you LOSE a match then.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2398354940/225715083?tab=stats

Me, AND the enemy team agreed that I was the only person on my team... the others were probably bots.

Now, ur telling me that after a win or two... Its ME that cant play at the new MMR? Can you explain how I was given 4 other players who just cant manage anything? That Ekko... just went HAM on Aatrox over and over. Never got a single gank from that Malphite and still won my lane and kept bot aflot. Nearly all of my deaths came from trying to turn back constant sieges and Aatrox managing to sneak up on me. Him being super fed from Ekko made even 1v1 vs him nearly impossible. Even then I was positive KDA most of the match and got most of my kills from people coming mid to to try and shut me down.

That match was a total joke.

I believe, like other people do, I got that match as a guaranteed loss to counteract my previous win. My teamates were the bottom of the barrel at the time that match was put together and it was done to arbitrarily curb my prievious success.

There is no way those people belonged in a match with me, I refuse to believe it. The enemy team wasnt very good either... but they were fed from the massive incompetence of every other lane and jg. There is no other way to look at it than I was sandbagged by Rito match making.

My top laner's MMR v the enemy top laners MMR: 1,275 v 1,169 [Difference of 106 in my favor]
My mid laner's MMR v the enemy mid laners MMR: 1,399 v 1,253 [Difference of 146 in my favor]

[Total difference of 234 against me]

So my team got worse by 329 MMR after my 2nd victory in a row. The enemy team, as it should be, got better by 122 after my 2nd victory in a row. The MMR difference in teams went from +376 to -234, a difference of 610! A difference of 610 MMR between teams across the span of a single game. So quite literally, everybody on my team was worse yet everybody on the enemy team was better.

It's because of riot's matchmaking system. The more you win, the more you lose. Riot's matchmaking system  will actually lower your teammates mmr and increase your opponents mmr to push you further towards a 50 percent win rate.

That's exactly how MMR works.

The MMR system will pit you against higher opponents if you win a bunch in a row.  The goal is to get you to a 50% win rate so it can match you against people in your proper league.  Your actual league will catch up eventually - that's why you gain more LP than you lose sometimes, if your MMR is higher.
Yea, I wounder if it's intended for smurfs, like "okay, you've won 7 in a row, now if you can carry these shitters you are a smurf and get super elo"

It's just the way they need to do it. If you win a bunch of games in a row, your MMR becomes higher than the average MMR in your current division, so the system will either place you with better players altogether, or make you the highest MMR player on your team more often. 

Some people don't realize what that means in terms of their own climb/improvement as a player. There's a big difference between being the middle MMR on your team and being the highest. They tend to look at it like oh I'm the best player on my team, even the game, I deserved to win, and not understand that yes that's the system's actual intention before the match started and you need to grind out more wins than you currently do AFTER a win streak if you want to climb.
haha dude im serious.

It's absolutely too consistent to be unintentional.  They have all but admitted it to me when I have emailed support.  What I used to do was just log out until win day.  I would not play because I cared about my ranking.  

What's upsetting is that, I don't get to play.   

What bothers me most though....is that it's intentional.  for all my work, I cannot carry 4 people that hard.  At least not these 4.

I don't think it's intentional, but an oversight. Something in their system adjusts too much at one time where you are matched with or against a 'worse' or 'better' team depending on your win/loss streak. It's intended so that everyone gets a ~50% win rate, but it's implemented the wrong way as many can see with the 'win streaks' and 'lose streaks' being so obvious at times.
